articles.title: A Visit to the Doctor
articles.articleText: Last Tuesday, I woke up feeling very ill. I had a terrible headache and a high fever. I also had a bad cough. I knew I could not go to work, so I called my office to tell my boss I was sick. Then, I decided I needed to see a doctor. I called the local clinic to make an appointment. The receptionist was very helpful. She said I could see Dr. Evans at 11:00 AM. I took a taxi to the clinic because I felt too weak to drive. When I arrived, I gave my name to the receptionist and sat down in the waiting room. There were a few other patients there. Some were reading magazines, and a little boy was playing with some toys. After about fifteen minutes, a nurse called my name. She took me to a small room and checked my temperature and blood pressure. My temperature was high. Then, Dr. Evans came in. He was a kind, older man with a friendly smile. I described my symptoms to him. I told him about my headache, fever, and cough. He listened carefully. He used a stethoscope to listen to my chest and looked in my throat. He said I had the flu. He told me it was very common in the winter. He wrote a prescription for some medicine and told me to get a lot of rest and drink plenty of water and juice. I went to the pharmacy next to the clinic to get the medicine. Now I am at home, resting in bed. I hope I feel better soon.

articles.title: The Four Seasons

The sun shines brightly, and people spend a lot of time outdoors. Many families go on holiday to the beach to swim in the sea and relax on the sand. I love eating ice cream on a hot summer day. The evenings are long and warm, perfect for having a barbecue with friends. After summer, autumn arrives. The weather becomes cooler, and the leaves on the trees change color to beautiful shades of red, yellow, and orange. People start to wear sweaters and light jackets. Autumn is also the season for harvesting fruits like apples and pumpkins. Finally, there is winter. Winter is the coldest season. Sometimes it snows, and everything is covered in a white blanket. It's beautiful, but it can be very cold. I like to stay inside, drink hot chocolate, and watch movies. People celebrate Christmas in winter, which is a very special time with family. Each season is different, and I enjoy the variety that the year brings.

I looked up and saw that I had walked into a street lamp. It didn't hurt, but I felt very silly. A few people on the street looked at me and smiled. I felt my face turn red. I put my phone in my pocket and continued walking, this time looking where I was going. When I arrived at the cafe, I saw Chloe sitting at a table by the window. I waved to her. As I walked towards her, my new shoe suddenly got caught on the leg of a chair. I lost my balance and fell. My bag flew open, and everything fell out onto the floor: my keys, my wallet, and my lipstick. This time, the whole cafe went quiet and looked at me. Chloe rushed to help me. She was trying not to laugh, but I could see a smile on her face. I just sat on the floor and started laughing too. It was a very clumsy day, but it's a funny story to tell now.

articles.title: My Favorite Type of Weather
articles.articleText: People have very different opinions about their favorite type of weather. Some people love the heat of summer, while others love the cold and snow of winter. For me, my favorite weather is a thunderstorm in the summer. I know it sounds a bit strange. Many people are afraid of thunderstorms. But I find them incredibly exciting and beautiful. It usually happens on a very hot and humid day. The sky starts to get dark, even in the middle of the afternoon. The air becomes very still and quiet. You know that something is about to happen. Then, you see the first flash of lightning. It's a bright, jagged line of light that illuminates the dark sky for a second. A few moments later, you hear the low rumble of thunder. As the storm gets closer, the lightning becomes more frequent and the thunder gets louder and louder until it's a huge crash that shakes the house. Then the rain starts. It's not a gentle rain; it's a heavy downpour that hammers on the roof and windows. I love to be inside and safe during a thunderstorm.
